Generation V.Black: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
Generation V.White: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.
Generation V.Black 2: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
Generation V.White 2: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

Generation VI.X: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
Generation VI.Y: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

Generation VII.Sun: It protects its plump posterior with the bones of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it replaces the bones.
Generation VII.Moon: It can't fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since it's still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Mandibuzz gives it the bones it wears. Vullaby's wings are short, so it can't fly yet, but it jumps around, dreaming of wide open skies.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

Generation VIII.Sword: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
Generation VIII.Shield: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

Generation IX.Scarlet: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.
Generation IX.Violet: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

Generation V.Black: Routes 10 and 11 , Victory Road , Village Bridge

Generation VIII.Shield: Route 8 , Stony Wilderness , Bridge Field Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell , West Lake Axewell , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield Expansion Pass: Potbottom Desert Loop Lagoon ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Fellhorn Gorge , Oni Mountain , Wistful Fields , Paradise Barrens , Kitakami Wilds Savanna Biome Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ )
